name: protective blink
description:
This is 'protective blink', a new video game from Outhouse Media. If your cybernetic eye is losing its focus, you can change the light source to reflect it back on your opponent.
Using a similar technology similar to those used in modern-day augmented reality, the developers of Outhouse's Project, have created a game to challenge your opponent's eyes. The developers behind the game have developed a new app using eye tracking to track and reignite your opponent's attentions. The game, called 'Protective Blink', lets you use the app to pick up a fallen object from an invisible distance in order to measure its size and type. Scroll down for video The game uses eye tracking to track the size and type of an object you need to measure in order to determine its size and its type. In the event the magic doesn't work, you can simply tap the screen to move to the corner and start the blink again. The app requires no internet connection to play. The device itself is designed to work with a combination of training and practice, and is designed to be worn at any time of day or night.
